user_request: Write a Shakespearean sonnet comparing a lover to a summer day.
final_poem:
When fair thou dost shine, as summer doth bestow
A gentle warmth upon my heart's dark night,
Thy love becomes the radiant sun that glows
And lights each corner of my soul with light.

The world, in all its beauty, cannot compare
To thee, dear one, whose loveliness I see;
For though the day may boast of sunshine rare,
Thou art more lovely than a thousand summers be.

But even summer's warmth doth fade to cold,
And darkness gathers at the end of May;
Yet still thy love remains, and never grows old,
Forever in my heart, it shines each day.

So let me cherish thee, dear one, as I would
This fleeting life, for thou art summer's bud.
